title: Stand Up To Cancer 2019: Harry Potter actor Tom Felton stars
text:
Tom Felton and Martin Freeman are among the stars in Stand Up To Cancer’s latest campaign.

Harry Potter star Tom Felton is among an array of actors joining forces to fight cancer in a new short film.

A range of stars, including Tom, Martin Freeman, Celia Imrie, Noel Clarke and Neil Morrissey are backing the return of a joint campaign between Cancer Research UK and Channel 4 in a moving film that sees each celebrity come up with their own innovative ways to raise money for life-saving cancer research.

The film opens with Martin Freeman telling the audience ‘cancer never sleeps, neither do we’ before each celebrity is seen taking a stand against the disease by scaling walls, boxing, break dancing and even dressing up as a carrot, to showcase the amount of both serious and funny ways funds can be raised to help fight the disease.

Speaking about his involvement in the charity, Tom, who is seen rock climbing in the video, said: ‘I really feel that if you have the opportunity to make the smallest difference, you should take it.

‘Research is so important in saving lives and bringing us closer to beating this disease. Cancer does not slow down for anyone, and neither will we.

‘We will continue to push towards getting innovative, new treatments to patients as quickly as possible.’

Martin Freeman added: ‘Stand Up To Cancer is a great opportunity to raise awareness of the tireless work that is being carried out by scientists across the UK every day.

‘Research is the key to making progress, and the sooner we fund more research, the sooner we can find better treatments and cures. No one should have to go through the pain cancer brings.’

The Stand Up To Cancer campaign will continue throughout October and urges people to get involved in raising money for live-saving cancer research by anything from fancy dress, to cooking for friends and family or taking on a gaming challenge.

Previous stars that have got involved in the campaign include Naomi Campbell, Noel Gallagher, Tom Hardy, Gillian Anderson, Idris Elba and James Corden.

For more information on how to get involved, head to the Stand Up For Cancer website.
